intro: Psychotria glandulicalyx var. camaniensis, commonly known as the Camanensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but have a mild, slightly bitter taste. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
